projectPurpose: To enable advanced, programmable smart contract capabilities on the Bitcoin network without requiring changes to its core protocol, by verifying off-chain computations on-chain.
mainFeatures: Enables Turing-complete smart contracts on Bitcoin
Requires no changes to Bitcoin's consensus rules
Acts as a trust-minimized bridge for second layers
Supports various computable functions via fraud proofs

mainFeatures: Brings smart contracts and dApps to Bitcoin

mainFeatures: Smart contract platform secured by Bitcoin
Secured by merged mining with Bitcoin

marketPositioning: BitVM is positioned as a novel paradigm for enabling complex, Turing-complete smart contracts on Bitcoin by shifting computation off-chain and using the Bitcoin network for verification through an optimistic rollup-like mechanism. Unlike other solutions that create separate blockchains or sidechains, BitVM aims to leverage Bitcoin's existing security and decentralization directly without requiring changes to its core protocol. This positions it as a potentially more trust-minimized way to bring advanced programmability to Bitcoin compared to alternative Layer 2s or sidechains, although its complexity and reliance on a prover-verifier model present different trade-offs.
